muito bom

Antes que nada, si no has jugado Portal 1, juégalo, es necesario.Portal 2 redescubre los portales añadiendo mecánicas nuevas mecánicas las cuales hacen que los puzzles suban de nivel y sean más complejos, que no te extrañe tirarte veinte minutos en un puzzle.La historia también cambia, todo cambia.El Cooperativo también está muy bien, si tienes a un amigo con quien jugarlo lo recomiendo muchísimo, vale la pena la experiencia.Toda una obra maestra, una secuela que cierra esta IP y que dudo no solo que se haga Portal 3, si no que innove lo suficiente como para cerrarla tan bien como lo ha hecho este juego.

One of my absolute favorite games. The story is even better than the first game and the multiplayer is super fun. I had a lot of fun playing and messing with my sister in it.
SÜRÜKLEYİCİ

Это просто культовая игра. 
Сочнейший чёрный юмор, который первую часть игры просто заставляет смеяться. 
Во второй части привыкаешь, но в конце шикарная песенка Глэдос. 
Головоломки стали сложнее, по сравнению с первой частью. И разнообразнее. 
Сюжет раскрывается в полной мере. А концовка оставляет приятное послевкусие. 
(Хотя и оставляет пару вопросов)
Графика приятна глазу. 
Игра не длинная, можно пройти за пару тройку часов спокойно. 
Советую всем,  в особенности любителям головоломок. 

P.S. На распродаже очень приятная цена.
ben çok beğenmedim tavsitede etme sadece 3 lira diye aldım :D

Nagyon jó játék a Valve 2011 ben is megmutatta hogy milyen egy jó játék, 2011 ben sok fasza játék jött ki pl Skyrim vagy a Call of Duty Modern Warfare 3 stb. Komplikalt Game a Portal de ajanlom nagyon!!!
A masterpiece.
Игра супер!

Overall a very good game, It has a lots of humor, as all Valve games do, you don't have to play the first game to understand the story (at least i didn't play the first one). Try to do all the achivements and find all the Ratman hideouts, for the full completion feel.
My most favorite part was chapter 8 (won't spoil it to you), and my most hated part was chapter 6 and 7, because it was so long, i watched the walkthroughts, because it just wasn't fun anymore, so long, but relevant for the background story.
I recommend this to all of you, who want to think about your decisions a little bit.

I think a lot of games, especially AAA games, pad out their games with hours and hours of meaningless content so that players think they got their money's worth. In my opinion, a game is about more than how many hours of your life you fill up with it.

Portal 2 is not like those games. While longer than its predecessor, it's still a very short game. You can finish the main story in less than 10 hours easily, even if you pay attention to the story and look around your surroundings, and the co-op mode adds on another 10-15 hours. But this is in no way shape or form a negative. Not a single minute of your playtime is wasted with repetitive, turn-off-your mind busywork. The feeling of satisfaction from completing this game is like what you get after a small, but still filling and delicious meal.

The main game consists of a series of levels leading up to a final boss fight. Each level either introduces new game mechanics or builds upon them in a logical way to create ever more complex puzzles. This game introduces many mechanics that were not in the previous game, although it removes the energy ball game mechanic (though it is replaced with lasers). I wouldn't say that it ever really gets particularly difficult at any point, and I'd say the true challenges are in the co-op mode, not the main story mode.

The game mechanics are much more refined over the last game. In Portal 1, going through misaligned portals would result in the camera attempting to reorient. Poor implementation meant that the camera movement would often get rather janky and not rotate in the direction you want. In Portal 2, this reorientation is a lot smoother and much faster, making it much easier to get your bearings after exiting a strangely aligned portal. While the gameplay is smoother, in certain ways it is a bit dumbed down to make it easier. For example, there's a mechanic in both games where the player gets aligned when falling in order to fall straight through the centre of portals, but in Portal 2 it's significantly stronger.

Portal rounds also travel much faster in this game. In the first game, you could visibly see how slow the Portal blasts moved, but in this game they must be travelling somewhere close to the speed of light. They probably did this due to the larger scale of the puzzle areas (also for story related reasons ;) ). 

Along the way, dialogue and environments serve to push the story forward. Through voices on the speaker, you slowly learn a great deal about the facility of Aperture Science, and the origins of our silent protagonist. Everything, from the environment design, dialogue, level design, etc. mix and flow together in a way that is too hard for my low IQ brain to explain properly. Everything just smoothly sets you up for the climax of the story in what I still consider the greatest video game ending of all time. I won't say any spoilers, but it is logical, foreshadowed, player-controlled, epic, and satisfying. Like the rest of the game, it is "just right."

Co-op has, as far as I can remember, more levels than the main story mode, and they are more difficult as well. Solving Portal levels with your friend actually works incredibly well and is very very fun. I would say it's even more fun than the main story!

Visually this game is a step up from the previous game. While clearly a bit dated by modern technical standards, I would say that it holds up aesthetically and they clearly concentrated on the elements of the graphics that would help it look good for as far into the future as possible. For this reason, despite being technically a product of its time, it is still a very nice looking game. Thanks to the less intensive graphics and the use of the very well optimised Source engine, it runs really really well on pretty much any system.

Overall, I would highly recommend this game if you liked the original. It's basically the same core game, but with more features, longer, a co-op mode, and with smoother gameplay. If you like puzzle games, this is of course also recommended, though the main story is not very difficult, so if you like challenge you should play the co-op courses, or even download mods for additional content. And, if you like good stories and some world-building, although short, the story mode offers a very neatly wrapped narrative with a satisfying conclusion, and the co-op mode gives you a nice epilogue.

This is Valve at their best. I wish they still made games of this calibre, but for now Portal 2 is one of the many classics Valve produced in their golden age. 10/10
un juego muy divertido y lo mejor que se puede jugar con amigos
game is funny,and so fun

Portal and Portal 2, the story of a lesbian romance between a mute woman and a (supposedly) immortal science-addicted control freak robot, with simplistic yet physically impossible game mechanics, and a immersive, replayable story that leaves you not wanting to step away. The game explores themes of love, death, time and morality, however, the true moral of the story will always be, when life gives you lemons....
Хороша игра. Особенно кооператив. Жалко что короткая

!WARNING!
PLAY PORTAL 1 BEFORE READING THIS REVIEW! Check out my Portal 1 review.


Portal 2 is a wonderful game about thinking 'outside the box'. You return as Chell in this game sequel, with the help of a personality core named Wheatley. You utilize a high-tech gun that fires portals, which lets you access areas by walking through said portals. GLaDOS returns as well, this time with a bone to pick. 

OVERALL
I highly recommend this treasure. However, please play Portal 1 before playing this. If not, you'll be left in the dark.

Co tu recenzować? Ta gra jest po prostu świetna. Za te marne kilka złoty na promocji otrzymujemy:
- Wciągającą fabułę, której przejście zajmie nam kilka godzin świetnej zabawy.
- Oddzielną fabułę w trybie kooperacji. W której możemy rozwiązywać zagadki wraz ze znajomym (jeszcze większa zabawa).
- Ponad 500.000 map jednoosobowych stworzonych przez społeczność.
- Ponad 100.000 map dwuosobowych stworzonych przez społeczność
- Edytor poziomów (możemy się wykazać tworząc własne zagadki).
Idealna dla każdego kto lubi zagadki, łamigłówki.

以下建议开发组修改一下：
1.中文字幕完全是机翻，大部分不知所云
2.转场时间太多太长，极大阻碍了游戏的流畅性
3.合作模式无法使用c和t，我根本无法沟通
4.逃脱时部分地图非常大，很阻碍解密（不过要是为了难度考虑的话就另说）
